summary: This bill, the Promoting Precision Agriculture Act, aims to enhance the use of precision agriculture in the United States. It defines key terms like "precision agriculture," "advanced wireless communications technology," and "trusted." The bill mandates the Secretary of Agriculture, in consultation with other agencies, to develop voluntary, consensus-based interconnectivity standards for precision agriculture within two years of enactment. The Comptroller General will assess these standards and report on their effectiveness every two years for eight years. The goal is to improve efficiency, reduce waste, and promote US leadership in setting standards for the field.
